body:
OK!
Thank you for your information.
I'll update license myself 🙇

Hi @koushik9951 we have a related issue for armeria to accept spring boot defaults for TLS configuration. Meanwhile, here are working instructions you can use.

```bash
# assuming you generate the key like this
keytool -genkeypair -alias koushik9951 -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -storetype PKCS12 -keystore zipkin.p12 -validity 3650

# enter the following overrides, note the password is key-store-password not key-password
java -jar zipkin.jar --armeria.ssl.key-store=zipkin.p12 --armeria.ssl.key-store-type=PKCS12 --armeria.ssl.key-store-password=123123 --armeria.ssl.key-alias=koushik9951  --armeria.ssl.enabled=true --armeria.ports[0].port=9411 --armeria.ports[0].protocols[0]=https
```

cc also @gquintana

Cool!!
Thank you!!
Sorry, I'll close this PR and make an other PR.
@adriancole: Thanks for updating with SSL details

Ack. thanks for mentioning but I think this is the better optimization

cool! in this change I assume the global search feature is replacing the existing and not yet extending into the dependencies screen, correct?

I have only one concern regarding the date. I think moving to a centered
modalbox makes it one movement more for those lazy like me. What about
having the usual "1h, 2h, 4h" and then another one saying "custom"
triggering the modalbox?

@adriancole 
Yes. In this PR I only replace existing the GlobalSearch.

@jcchavezs Good point. Currently there are only seven fixed lookbacks, so I agree with what you say, now. However, I intend to increase the number of fixed lookbacks in the future. Like Grafana: If I do that, I think modal box is the most appropriate.

I think we better quickly discuss that as an issue. @adriancole might know
better about the common lookbacks but I know many people has retention no
more than 4 days (in my case it is 3) so grafana lookbacks might not apply.
Remember metrics are way smaller than traces so retention is not a real
issue whereas in zipkin, depending on the retention and the storage, more
than 2 days might be unachievable.

Yeah, I agree with you. (in my case, retention is 7 days).

I picked up options that we could use in our UI from grafana lookback options.
There are 15 options.

* Last 5 minutes
* Last 15 minutes
* Last 30 minutes
* Last 1 hour
* Last 2 hours
* Last 6 hours
* Last 12 hours
* Last 24 hours
* Last 2 days
* Last 7 days
* Today
* Yesterday
* Day before yesterday
* This day last week
* Custom

I think dropdown menu with 15 options are too large to use.

What do you think about showing only `1 hour`, `2hours`, `6hours`, `12hours`, and `more...` in a dropdown menu?
When user click `more...`, modalbox will appear with the above whole options.

I think the choices you just displayed are entirely reasonable and unless
folks have a concern with them, perfectly good start for this pull request.
Fine tuning can always happen in practice. I like that you chose lookbacks
relevant to most people's trace date!

> ZipkinActiveMQPropertiesOverrideTest has wrong words（zapkin ->zipkin）

this is intentional :) to make sure the default can be changed

I was able to connect to AWS MQ like this. I think similar to sqs and elasticsearch, we could add a helper in zipkin-aws to generate the config lines. cc @llinder @devinsba 

```bash
ACTIVEMQ_URL='failover:(ssl://b-da18ebe4-54ff-4dfc-835f-3862a6c144b1-1.mq.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com:61617,ssl://b-da18ebe4-54ff-4dfc-835f-3862a6c144b1-2.mq.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com:61617)' ACTIVEMQ_USERNAME=zipkin ACTIVEMQ_PASSWORD=zipkin12345678 ACTIVEMQ_CONCURRENCY=8 java -jar ./zipkin-server/target/zipkin-server-*exec.jar --logging.level.zipkin2=DEBUG
```

actually I asked you specifically before to please use gitter because what you've been doing is spamming watchers. https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2616 Please don't create another similar issue until you use gitter

We don't use issues for questions, so please follow-up on gitter https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin

The format is different. Zipkin V1 is and old (on deprecation) much more
verbose and requieres more data whereas zipkin v2 is the new, simple and
concise. While zipkin-go-opentracing is supporting only v1 ATM, there is an
ongoing effort to move it into v2 (which will be finished in the upcoming
weeks, see
https://github.com/openzipkin-contrib/zipkin-go-opentracing/pull/123). We
highly recommend to avoid v1 clients if possible.

BTW, for further questions like this join us on gitter: https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin
ok, got it. Hope to see  that ` zipkin-go-opentracing`  supports for zipkin v2.

In my opinion this is a nice to have feature and not something that is needed absolutely. In the current search capability, user is dealing with 10s of traces and is ok to skim through the sorted list. I found the Zipkin Classic useful to list the traces.

Showing a summary of a trace in the listing looks good. Better than the current impl where the page is too busy with too many colors. Difficult to lookup a trace.

Even if we want to implement the scattered plot. I would like the summary listing implemented first and then think about the scattered plot later.
maybe just me but it "feels" faster. I love playing with this, and I have tried complex and simple traces in all views including upload

I'm really sorry for the large PR...
It was impossible for me to split the changes well.

The previous implementation was too complex to understand how it works, so I had to rewrite the entire GlobalSearch component, which is the largest component of Lens.

Thank you very much for you trust.

very looking forward to this @tacigar!

I am presuming you are having a concern with your data as opposed to the
display of it. it is not a problem or even unusual for sub spans to be
longer than their parent.

the most common reason this can occur is a difference in "done" semantics.
for example, one side thinks it is done when headers are read and he other
when the body is read.

since we dont use github issues for general q&a I suggest moving any
further questions to gitter or zipkin-user@googlegroups.com

also this github repo can only change the server or the ui. if instead you
think the data correct, but is being presented incorrectly please let us
know.

Related to #2636

Updated `zipkin-server` too and this is getting better, but one WIP is setting connect timeout, which isn't too hard but will bring back the `close` method on the storage which I thought wasn't needed by using Armeria's default clientfactory.

Also for the record, want to say it was quite painful updating the `zipkin-server` tests due to Kotlin. Not only is it unfamiliar and a big context switch, but I find it has quite strange syntax and quirks when integrating with normal Java libraries - for the life of me I couldn't get `assertThat(Throwable).satisfies { checks }` to even compile. So another post-humous vote against the Kotlin tests ;)
very good job. I tried locally and smooth!
Thank you!

appreciate the offer, but I think the style of these generated tests is not very good. They feel cluttered and distracting. Also, this adds a dependency for routine state checking which I don't think we require. 

Considering the endpoint class is before this change at 95% methods and 90% lines, it is probably better to look at the parts not covered and create tests based on the semantics of the type. There isn't much left to do on this one.

![Screenshot 2019-07-09 at 9 57 51 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64215/60894173-c7a74b00-a294-11e9-9f8c-0aa6b85aaffa.png)

If you are looking to add pull requests based on generated code, probably a better start next time would be asking us. We're usually on gitter. Thanks anyway, though!

https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin
ps I do think what you are doing is neat btw.. it can be difficult to identify corner cases in legacy code and I think the utility you are working on has promise, even if not a great fit for us.

appreciate the feedback rag. it isnt an irreversible thing (kotlin tests)
though I am not sure if intellij will help the other direction or not. in
hindsight I think more may have thought it was a nice idea in abstract than
were directly impacted in a good or bad way. you are the first to feel
impact and while it might be water under the bridge.. reversing is an
option.
